column2: ARKANSAS DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 2. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
3. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
4. This sign means:
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 5. If your vehicle has a mechanical problem, you should:
column4: stop in your lane and put on your emergency flashers.
column6: turn on your hazard lights and pull off the road.
column8: signal and pull into the slow lane.

column2: 6. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column8: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column8: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

9. This road sign means:
10. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 11. Most signs used in street work areas are:
12. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.
column6: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column8: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.

column2: 13. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column6: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 14. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: tailgate the driver in front of you.
column8: drive above the posted speed limit.

column2: 15. A steady green light at intersections means:
column8: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 16. To avoid traction loss from hydroplaning, drivers should:
column4: apply the brakes as soon as the car starts to skid.

column2: 17. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: oncoming vehicles might not see you.
column6: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
column8: the light will reflect back into your eyes.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
19. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column6: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 20. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
21. Driver distractions include:
column6: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.
column8: Slowing down to look at crash scene.

column2: 22. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 23. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
